page.title: 15Entertainment in Dean
page.content: As in most villages entertainment is provided by the villagers. The main event is the "pantomime". Every year a group of enthusiastic villagers get together and perform a pantomime on a Friday evening and Saturday afternoon and evening after Christmas at the Eileen Wade School and it is immensely enjoyed by participants and audience. It seems that each year key people move away, but other enthusiastic newcomers are encouraged to join in. Many of the village clubs organise events, mainly for fund raising but also as social gatherings. The cricket club hold a monthly whist drive in the winter which is very popular. There are occasional concerts in the church, using local talent. The Harvest Supper is a well supported social event.
